alert.note: Alert for Boone; Cabell; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Putnam; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 1:11AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cabell, northern Kanawha, Putnam, Lincoln, northwestern Logan, northeastern Wayne and northwestern Boone Counties through 145 AM EST... At 110 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Winfield to near Ona. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Winfield, Hamlin, Beech Fork State Park, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Sissonville, Milton, Eleanor, Poca, Ranger, Pinch, Culloden, Spurlockville, Institute and Tornado. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 117. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 25 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 94 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 54 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Cabell; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Putnam; Wayne
